required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact Of Eplerenone On Cardiovascular Outcomes In Patients Post Myocardial Infarction
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled Trial Evaluating The Safety And Efficacy Of Early Treatment With Eplerenone In Patients With Acute Myocardial Infarction

brief_summary.textblock: Administration of eplerenone within 24 hours of onset of symptoms of myocardial infarction, in patients without heart failure, reduces cardiovascular mortality / morbidity.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: First Event of Cardiovascular Mortality, Re-hospitalization or Extended Initial Hospital Stay Due to Diagnosis of Heart Failure, Sustained Ventricular Tachycardia or Fibrillation, Ejection Fraction ≤40% or BNP Above Age Adjusted Cut Off
primary_outcome.description: Cardiovascular mortality is defined as any mortality adjudicated as death due to sudden cardiac death, myocardial infarction (MI), worsening heart failure, cardiac arrhythmia, other cause (such as pulmonary embolism, peripheral arterial disease [PAD], etc.). Hospitalization due to congestive heart failure (CHF) and requires extended hospital stay or frequent visits to emergency room, observation unit or in-patient care, due to CHF as the primary or secondary diagnosis supported by a discharge report or clinical summary for hospitalization as determined by the endpoint adjudication committee (EAC). A composite of time to first event of cardiovascular mortality (CV), re-hospitalization or extended initial hospital stay due to diagnosis of heart failure, sustained ventricular tachycardia or fibrillation, ejection fraction ≤40% after 1 month or BNP >200 pg/mL or NT-proBNP >450 pg/mL (age <50 years); >900 pg/mL (age 50 to 75 years) or >1800 pg/mL (age >75 years) after 1 month.

secondary_outcome.description: The occurrence of cardiovascular mortality from randomization. Time-to-event analyses were measured from the date of randomization. A subject who did not experience the endpoint(s) of interest was censored on the last day the subject was confirmed by the investigator to be endpoint-free. The time-to-event distributions were summarized by treatment group using Kaplan-Meier estimates of cumulative incidence.

The occurrence of first diagnosis of heart failure from the date of randomization. Time-to-event analyses were measured from the date of randomization, and a subject who did not experience the endpoint(s) of interest was censored on the last day the subject was confirmed by the investigator to be endpoint-free. The time-to-event distributions were summarized by treatment group using Kaplan-Meier estimates of cumulative incidence.

secondary_outcome.measure: First and Each Subsequent Episode (After an Event Free Interval of ≥ 48 Hours) of Sustained Ventricular Tachycardia or Ventricular Fibrillation.
secondary_outcome.description: The occurrence of first and each subsequent episode (after an event-free interval of ≥ 48 hours) of sustained ventricular tachycardia or ventricular fibrillation. Time-to-event analyses were measured from the date of randomization. A subject who did not experience the endpoint(s) of interest was censored on the last day the subject was confirmed by the investigator to be endpoint-free. The time-to-event distributions were summarized by treatment group using Kaplan-Meier estimates of cumulative incidence.

secondary_outcome.measure: First Recorded Ejection Fraction (EF) of ≤40% (Recorded 1 Month or Later Post-randomization).
secondary_outcome.description: The occurrence of first recorded EF ≤40% (recorded 28 days or later post-randomization). Time-to-event analyses were measured from the date of randomization. A subject who did not experience the endpoint(s) of interest was censored on the last day the subject was confirmed by the investigator to be endpoint-free. The time-to-event distributions were summarized by treatment group using Kaplan-Meier estimates of cumulative incidence.

secondary_outcome.measure: Brain (B-type) Natriuretic Peptide (BNP) >200 pg/mL or NT-proBNP >450, >900 or >1800 pg/mL for Ages <50 Years, 50-75 Years and >75 Years, Respectively (Recorded 1 Month or Later Post-randomization).
secondary_outcome.description: The occurrence of first occurrence of BNP >200 pg/mL or NT-proBNP >450, >900 or >1800 pg/mL for ages <50 years, 50 to 75 years and >75 years, respectively (recorded 28 days or later post-randomization). Time-to-event analyses were measured from the date of randomization. A subject who did not experience the endpoint(s) of interest was censored on the last day the subject was confirmed by the investigator to be endpoint-free. The time-to-event distributions were summarized by treatment group using Kaplan-Meier estimates of cumulative incidence.

secondary_outcome.measure: Decision to Provide an Implantable Cardioverter Defibrillator (ICD) or Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy (CRT).
secondary_outcome.description: The decision to provide an ICD or CRT. Time-to-event analyses were measured from the date of randomization. A subject who did not experience the endpoint(s) of interest was censored on the last day the subject was confirmed by the investigator to be endpoint-free. The time-to-event distributions were summarized by treatment group using Kaplan-Meier estimates of cumulative incidence.

secondary_outcome.measure: Second or Subsequent Non-fatal Myocardial Infarction (MI).
secondary_outcome.description: The occurrence of second or subsequent nonfatal MI. Time-to-event analyses were measured from the date of randomization. A subject who did not experience the endpoint(s) of interest was censored on the last day the subject was confirmed by the investigator to be endpoint-free. The time-to-event distributions were summarized by treatment group using Kaplan-Meier estimates of cumulative incidence.

secondary_outcome.measure: Electrocardiogram Q Wave to the End of the S Wave Corresponding to Ventricle Depolarization (QRS) Duration at 6 Months Post-randomization.
secondary_outcome.description: Electrocardiogram Q wave to the end of the S wave corresponding to ventricle depolarization (QRS) duration at 6 months post-randomization. The continuous endpoints were assessed using analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) model, fitted with corresponding baseline and treatment. These were analyzed at 6 months based on last observation carried forward (LOCF) and also using all available data up to end of study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Left Atrial Diameter (LAD) (Recorded on Each Occasion an Echocardiogram is Conducted).
secondary_outcome.description: LAD recorded each time an echocardiogram is conducted. The continuous endpoints were assessed using ANCOVA model, fitted with corresponding baseline and treatment. These were analyzed at 6 months based on LOCF and also using all available data up to end of study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Serum Levels of Biomarkers (Aldosterone and Cortisol) at 6 Months Post-randomization.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in serum levels of aldosterone and cortisol at 6 months post-randomization. The continuous endpoints were assessed using ANCOVA model, fitted with corresponding baseline and treatment. These were analyzed at 6 months based on LOCF and also using all available data up to end of study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Serum Levels of Biomarkers (PIIINP, Galectin 3, and PINP) at 6 Months Post-randomization.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in serum levels of PIIINP, Galectin 3, and PINP at 6 months post-randomization. The continuous endpoints were assessed using ANCOVA model, fitted with corresponding baseline and treatment. These were analyzed at 6 months based on LOCF and also using all available data up to end of study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Serum Level of Biomarker (ICTP) at 6 Months Post-randomization.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in serum level of ICTP at 6 months post-randomization. The continuous endpoint was assessed using ANCOVA model, fitted with corresponding baseline and treatment. It was analyzed at 6 months based on LOCF and also using all available data up to end of study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Serum Level of Biomarker (Interleukin-6) at 6 Months Post-randomization.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in serum level of Interleukin-6 at 6 months post-randomization. The continuous endpoint was assessed using ANCOVA model, fitted with corresponding baseline and treatment. It was analyzed at 6 months based on LOCF and also using all available data up to end of study.

arm_group.description: Matching placebo for eplerenone 25mg film coated tablets.

intervention.description: Maximum dose of 2x25 mg film coated tablets per day for the duration of the study (approximately 18 months maximum). Lower doses may be administered determined by blood biochemistry data.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects must have experienced a myocardial infarction (STEMI) within the previous 24 hours confirmed by symptoms and ECG.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with a known low ejection fraction of less than 40% or any previous history of heart failure.
- Subjects treated with eplerenone or other aldosterone antagonists within the past 1 month.
- The subject has uncontrolled hypotension (SBP<90mmHg).
- Subjects with eGFR ≤30ml/min (based on admission serum creatinine and the MDRD formula) or serum creatinine ≥220µmol/L.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 1012 subjects were enrolled for participation in this study. A total of 505 subjects were randomized to treatment with eplerenone and 505 subjects were randomized to the placebo group; a total of 422 and 424 subjects in the eplerenone and placebo groups, respectively, completed the study.

group.title: Eplerenone Plus Standard of Care
group.description: Eplerenone group received eplerenone 25 milligram (mg) once daily (OD), and on day 2, the dose of study drug increased to 50 mg OD (2 tablets) if serum potassium <5.0 mmol/L and with normal renal function.

group.title: Placebo Plus Standard of Care
group.description: Placebo group received matching placebo for eplerenone 25 milligram (mg) film coated tablets.

group.title: Eplerenone Plus Standard of Care
group.description: Eplerenone group received eplerenone 25 milligram (mg) once daily (OD), and on day 2, the dose of study drug increased to 50 mg OD (2 tablets) if serum potassium <5.0 mmol/L and with normal renal function.

group.title: Placebo Plus Standard of Care
group.description: Placebo group received matching placebo for eplerenone 25 milligram (mg) film coated tablets.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: First Event of Cardiovascular Mortality, Re-hospitalization or Extended Initial Hospital Stay Due to Diagnosis of Heart Failure, Sustained Ventricular Tachycardia or Fibrillation, Ejection Fraction ≤40% or BNP Above Age Adjusted Cut Off
outcome.description: Cardiovascular mortality is defined as any mortality adjudicated as death due to sudden cardiac death, myocardial infarction (MI), worsening heart failure, cardiac arrhythmia, other cause (such as pulmonary embolism, peripheral arterial disease [PAD], etc.). Hospitalization due to congestive heart failure (CHF) and requires extended hospital stay or frequent visits to emergency room, observation unit or in-patient care, due to CHF as the primary or secondary diagnosis supported by a discharge report or clinical summary for hospitalization as determined by the endpoint adjudication committee (EAC). A composite of time to first event of cardiovascular mortality (CV), re-hospitalization or extended initial hospital stay due to diagnosis of heart failure, sustained ventricular tachycardia or fibrillation, ejection fraction ≤40% after 1 month or BNP >200 pg/mL or NT-proBNP >450 pg/mL (age <50 years); >900 pg/mL (age 50 to 75 years) or >1800 pg/mL (age >75 years) after 1 month.
outcome.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) using the intent-to-treat (ITT) principle, regardless of compliance with the study drug and the protocol was used. The efficacy analysis data sets for clinical events included all available study endpoints.

group.title: Eplerenone Plus Standard of Care
group.description: Eplerenone group received eplerenone 25 milligram (mg) once daily (OD), and on day 2, the dose of study drug increased to 50 mg OD (2 tablets) if serum potassium <5.0 mmol/L and with normal renal function.

group.title: Placebo Plus Standard of Care
group.description: Placebo group received matching placebo for eplerenone 25 milligram (mg) film coated tablets.

measure.title: First Event of Cardiovascular Mortality, Re-hospitalization or Extended Initial Hospital Stay Due to Diagnosis of Heart Failure, Sustained Ventricular Tachycardia or Fibrillation, Ejection Fraction ≤40% or BNP Above Age Adjusted Cut Off
measure.description: Cardiovascular mortality is defined as any mortality adjudicated as death due to sudden cardiac death, myocardial infarction (MI), worsening heart failure, cardiac arrhythmia, other cause (such as pulmonary embolism, peripheral arterial disease [PAD], etc.). Hospitalization due to congestive heart failure (CHF) and requires extended hospital stay or frequent visits to emergency room, observation unit or in-patient care, due to CHF as the primary or secondary diagnosis supported by a discharge report or clinical summary for hospitalization as determined by the endpoint adjudication committee (EAC). A composite of time to first event of cardiovascular mortality (CV), re-hospitalization or extended initial hospital stay due to diagnosis of heart failure, sustained ventricular tachycardia or fibrillation, ejection fraction ≤40% after 1 month or BNP >200 pg/mL or NT-proBNP >450 pg/mL (age <50 years); >900 pg/mL (age 50 to 75 years) or >1800 pg/mL (age >75 years) after 1 month.
measure.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) using the intent-to-treat (ITT) principle, regardless of compliance with the study drug and the protocol was used. The efficacy analysis data sets for clinical events included all available study endpoints.

analysis.groups_desc: Hazard ratio, 95% confidence interval (CI) of hazard ratio, and p-value for the Primary Analysis based on a Cox proportional hazard model with treatment as the major factor, adjusted for baseline estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR), with/without previous MI, time of first dose administered post onset of index symptom, and location of index MI anterior or non-anterior.
analysis.p_value_desc: All analyses for primary endpoint were tested at two-sided, α-level of 0.05, without adjusting for multiplicity.

outcome.title: Cardiovascular Mortality
outcome.description: The occurrence of cardiovascular mortality from randomization. Time-to-event analyses were measured from the date of randomization. A subject who did not experience the endpoint(s) of interest was censored on the last day the subject was confirmed by the investigator to be endpoint-free. The time-to-event distributions were summarized by treatment group using Kaplan-Meier estimates of cumulative incidence.
outcome.population: The FAS using the ITT principle, regardless of compliance with the study drug and the protocol was used. The efficacy analysis data sets for clinical events included all available study endpoints. Furthermore, only events confirmed by the EAC were used.

measure.title: Electrocardiogram Q Wave to the End of the S Wave Corresponding to Ventricle Depolarization (QRS) Duration at 6 Months Post-randomization.
measure.description: Electrocardiogram Q wave to the end of the S wave corresponding to ventricle depolarization (QRS) duration at 6 months post-randomization. The continuous endpoints were assessed using analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) model, fitted with corresponding baseline and treatment. These were analyzed at 6 months based on last observation carried forward (LOCF) and also using all available data up to end of study.
measure.population: The FAS using the ITT principle, regardless of compliance with the study drug and the protocol was used.

analysis.groups_desc: ANCOVA model was used with observed value as the dependent variable, treatment as a major factor, and baseline QRS duration, baseline eGFR, with/without previous MI, time (in hours) of first dose administered post onset of index symptom, and location of index MI (anterior versus all other locations) as covariates.

outcome.title: Left Atrial Diameter (LAD) (Recorded on Each Occasion an Echocardiogram is Conducted).
outcome.description: LAD recorded each time an echocardiogram is conducted. The continuous endpoints were assessed using ANCOVA model, fitted with corresponding baseline and treatment. These were analyzed at 6 months based on LOCF and also using all available data up to end of study.
outcome.population: The FAS using the ITT principle, regardless of compliance with the study drug and the protocol was used.

group.title: Eplerenone Plus Standard of Care
group.description: Eplerenone group received eplerenone 25 milligram (mg) once daily (OD), and on day 2, the dose of study drug increased to 50 mg OD (2 tablets) if serum potassium <5.0 mmol/L and with normal renal function.

group.title: Placebo Plus Standard of Care
group.description: Placebo group received matching placebo for eplerenone 25 milligram (mg) film coated tablets.

measure.title: Left Atrial Diameter (LAD) (Recorded on Each Occasion an Echocardiogram is Conducted).
measure.description: LAD recorded each time an echocardiogram is conducted. The continuous endpoints were assessed using ANCOVA model, fitted with corresponding baseline and treatment. These were analyzed at 6 months based on LOCF and also using all available data up to end of study.
measure.population: The FAS using the ITT principle, regardless of compliance with the study drug and the protocol was used.

analysis.groups_desc: For the Between-Treatment difference for Eplerenone and Placebo groups of observed value taken at Month 6 visit, ANCOVA model was performed for LAD based on the LOCF method including treatment groups with/without adjustments for baseline eGFR (in mL/min/1.73 m2), previous MI (yes/no), time (in hours) of first dose administered post-onset of symptom, index MI location (anterior versus all others) as covariates.
analysis.p_value_desc: ANCOVA was used for between-treatment comparisons of the LSMeans, 95% CI of LSMEANS, LSMeans difference, 95% CI of LSMeans difference, and p-value with observed value at the given time point as variable.

analysis.groups_desc: For the Between-Treatment difference for Eplerenone and Placebo groups of observed value taken at Month 6 visit, ANCOVA model was performed for LAD based on the LOCF method including treatment groups with/without adjustments for baseline eGFR (in mL/min/1.73 m2), previous MI (yes/no), time (in hours) of first dose administered post-onset of symptom, index MI location (anterior versus all others) as covariates.
analysis.p_value_desc: ANCOVA was used for between-treatment comparisons of the LSMeans, 95% CI of LSMEANS, LSMeans difference, 95% CI of LSMeans difference, and p-value with observed value at the given time point as variable.

outcome.title: Change in Serum Levels of Biomarkers (Aldosterone and Cortisol) at 6 Months Post-randomization.
outcome.description: Change in serum levels of aldosterone and cortisol at 6 months post-randomization. The continuous endpoints were assessed using ANCOVA model, fitted with corresponding baseline and treatment. These were analyzed at 6 months based on LOCF and also using all available data up to end of study.
outcome.population: The Biomarker Analysis Set is a subset of FAS subjects who have the biomarker data (carboxyterminal telopeptide of type I collagen [ICTP], procollagen type I N-terminal peptide [PINP], procollagen type III N-terminal peptide [PIIINP], Interleukin-6, aldosterone, cortisol, and Galactin 3) available.

group.title: Eplerenone Plus Standard of Care
group.description: Eplerenone group received eplerenone 25 milligram (mg) once daily (OD), and on day 2, the dose of study drug increased to 50 mg OD (2 tablets) if serum potassium <5.0 mmol/L and with normal renal function.

group.title: Placebo Plus Standard of Care
group.description: Placebo group received matching placebo for eplerenone 25 milligram (mg) film coated tablets.

measure.title: Change in Serum Levels of Biomarkers (Aldosterone and Cortisol) at 6 Months Post-randomization.
measure.description: Change in serum levels of aldosterone and cortisol at 6 months post-randomization. The continuous endpoints were assessed using ANCOVA model, fitted with corresponding baseline and treatment. These were analyzed at 6 months based on LOCF and also using all available data up to end of study.
measure.population: The Biomarker Analysis Set is a subset of FAS subjects who have the biomarker data (carboxyterminal telopeptide of type I collagen [ICTP], procollagen type I N-terminal peptide [PINP], procollagen type III N-terminal peptide [PIIINP], Interleukin-6, aldosterone, cortisol, and Galactin 3) available.

analysis.groups_desc: For Biomarker- Aldosterone, signed rank test for change from baseline at Month 6 within treatment difference was used to derive p-value.
For Biomarker- Aldosterone, signed rank test for change from baseline at Month 6 within treatment difference was used to derive p-value.
For Biomarker- Aldosterone, Wilconxon rank-sum test for between treatment difference at Month 6 was used to derive p-value.
For Biomarker- Serum Cortisol, signed rank test for change from baseline at Month 6 within treatment difference was used to derive p-value.
For Biomarker- Serum Cortisol, signed rank test for change from baseline at Month 6 within treatment difference was used to derive p-value.
For Biomarker- Serum Cortisol, Wilconxon rank-sum test for between treatment difference at Month 6 was used to derive p-value.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Lung squamous cell carcinoma stage unspecified
event.description: Lung squamous cell carcinoma stage unspecified

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
